docs.lead_paragraph: Not only do doctors without patients exist, they thrive: they are the administrators, the professors, the directors and the chief executives.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Review Sees No Advantage in 12-Step Programs'' (July 25): I read with interest the article on research done on the Alcoholics Anonymous program. I was concerned that there was no mention that A.A. is free and readily available -- in person, online and internationally. The other modalities mentioned require not only willingness but also health insurance, and some require screening by a professional. In referring people for help, these are often barriers to treatment. Kathleen A. Gilbert Stamford, Conn.
docs.abstract: Kathleen A Gilbert letter on July 25 article about Alcoholics Anonymous program suggests that anyone can attend meetings; holds that most other treatment programs require insurance or are expensive
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Review Sees No Advantage in 12-Step Programs'' (July 25): I read with interest the article on research done on the Alcoholics Anonymous program. I was concerned that there was no mention that A.A. is free and readily available...
